natural solution: First we simplify $\frac{8}{10}$, \[ \frac{8}{10} = \frac{2}{2}\cdot\frac{4}{5}=1\cdot\frac{4}{5} =\frac{4}{5}. \]Now make both terms have a common denominator, \[ \frac{2}{7}+\frac{4}{5}= \frac{5}{5}\cdot\frac{2}{7}+\frac{7}{7}\cdot\frac{4}{5} = \frac{10}{35}+\frac{28}{35}

=\boxed{\frac{38}{35}}. \]Note that we could have done the problem without simplifying $\frac{8}{10}$ at the beginning and instead simplified at the end, but in this case simplifying first made things simpler as we didn't need to carry around the extra factor of two.

 First we simplify $\frac{8}{10}$, \[ \frac{8}{10} = \frac{2}{2}\cdot\frac{4}{5}=1\cdot\frac{4}{5} =\frac{4}{5}. \]Now make both terms have a common denominator, \[ \frac{2}{7}+\frac{4}{5}= \frac{5}{5}\cdot\frac{2}{7}+\frac{7}{7}\cdot\frac{4}{5} = \frac{10}{35}+\frac{28}{35}
 =\boxed{\frac{38}{35}}. \]Note that we could have done the problem without simplifying $\frac{8}{10}$ at the beginning and instead simplified at the end, but in this case simplifying first made things simpler as we didn't need to carry around the extra factor of two.
 *)

fixes x y z :: real
assumes h0 : "x = 2 / 7"
and h1 : "y = 8 / 10"
and h2 : "z = x + y"

 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
